humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a gross measurement of the largest tumor as 3.7 cm, which falls within the range for a T2 tumor (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma, so the T stage is still T2. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma, so the T stage is still T2. Tumor size is used to determine the T stage, even when the histological type is Medullary Adenocarcinoma, so the T stage is still T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, the largest dimension of the tumor is measured to be 3.7 cm (gross measurement, see comment) in the section D: Breast, right, total mastectomy. Therefore, the T stage for this cancer is T2.
